name: Curried Scallops with Angel Hair Pasta
author: llwhite
ingredients: ¼ cup fat free, low-sodium chicken broth
¼ cup fat free, low-sodium chicken broth
directions: Bring a pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Cook angel hair in the boiling water until cooked through yet firm to the bite, 4 to 5 minutes; drain
Divide between 2 plates and keep warm
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat
Cook and stir onion in the hot oil until softened, about 3 minutes
Stir curry powder into the onion; cook and stir 1 minute more
Transfer the onion mixture to a blender; add 1/4 cup chicken broth along with evaporated milk and tomato paste
Return the skillet to medium heat
Sear scallops on each side in the hot skillet, 2 to 3 minutes per side
Place scallops atop the angel hair pasta; keep warm
Pour 1/4 cup chicken broth into the pan; bring to a boil while scraping the browned bits of food off of the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon
Pour the contents of the skillet into the blender; blend until smooth and return the mixture to the skillet
Simmer the sauce until warm; pour over the scallops and pasta to serve
